Dialogue.Text: George? Am I seeing things? Are you real?
It's me, my love. I miss you so much.
I miss you too, dear. Your ceremony yesterday was lovely. But why you haven't passed over yet?
I wanted to play a game of sudoku with you before I moved on. Will you play with me one last time?
Of course, dear.
Thank you, my love. I feel ready to move on.
Before I go, honey... maybe you could help the others too?
They're trapped. They have unresolved issues from that tragic accident of 1964.
Could you talk to my childhood friend, Charlotte, about it?
I'll see what I can do.
Why don't you play some sudoku with them. Maybe it will help them open up to you?
Thank you honey! I'll always love you!
I'll always love you too.
Hello, dear. Are you Charlotte by any chance?
Hello? I think so.
My memory is a bit hazy.
I think I have a trick for that.
I think that actually worked! My memory is slowly coming back to me.
Is there anything I can help you with?
I was actually wondering if there was anything I could help you with.
My late husband George said that something happened in 1964?
That sounds really familiar. I know! That's the year I died!
I was married to Bruce. He was the best husband. He provided so much for us.
And, my sister, Martha, always looked out for me, especially so on my death bed.
Anyway, would you be able to talk to some of the other ghosts about the accident?
See if you can put some more of the pieces together for me?
Maybe you should go and talk to Martha. She's very observant.
Are you Martha?
Yes, that name sounds really familiar.
Charlotte sent me over here to talk to you, to see if you knew anything about the cause of her death.
I'm having trouble remembering details.
Let me try to help.
I think that may have actually worked.
I remember that I used to work in a materials factory with Edith.
That woman! All she knew was how to gossip and talk about herself.
Maybe go talk to her since she loves a good scandal.
Or maybe you could talk to Bruce, Charlotte's husband. He was always looking after her.
Hello, dear. I assume you're Edith?
Who's asking?
Martha said that I should go talk to an Edith about what happened to Charlotte?
The truth is, I'm not sure who I am.
Let me try to help.
That was really weird. But it worked.
I'm starting to remember Charlotte, in a negative way.
I didn't like her very much. I was jealous of her 'perfect' marriage.
My own marriage was on the rocks. Jasper was always too busy with the farm, and drank at Bruce's pub every night.
I'm so sorry, dear.
Could you leave me alone for now, please? I just want to think about some things.
Of course. I'll go find Bruce.
Hello there, is there perhaps any chance your name is Bruce?
I'm pretty sure it is. Why's that?
I've talked to Charlotte, Martha and Edith, who have all mentioned that you're Charlotte's husband.
I was wondering if you could shed a little bit of light on the situation?
Unfortunately I don't really remember these people.
I have a trick that seems to work with the others, let me give it a go.
I remember my wife Charlotte. She was the kindest, sweetest and most considerate wife.
She was what some referred to as the most 'ideal kind of wife'.
Though, our marriage just started to get so boring, there was no excitement in it anymore.
I also used to work in a pub and a man called Jasper would come to drink almost every night.
He would usually just drunkenly moan and ramble about his failing life and marriage.
You should go and talk to him.
Hello there! Jasper, I assume?
I believe that's my name. Was there something you need?
I'm trying to find some information on Charlotte's death.
I'm sorry, I can't help you there ma'am. I'm afraid I can't remember much from my past life.
Don't worry. I know a trick to fix that.
Great, all I remember is how miserable I was.
Everyday I would go to work on the dairy farm, and finish off my day by drinking my sorrows away at Bruce's pub.
I didn't really have any friends and I was beginning to despise my wife for her lack of intimacy.
I'm sorry to hear that. I'll let you be for now and come talk to you later when you're ready.
I've talked to everyone here and they're slowly starting to regain their memories just like you
I'll keep helping you all until we get to the bottom of this, so that you can all pass on.
Thank you, that's very kind of you!
Can we play that puzzle game of yours again please?
Of course!
I'm not remembering good things.
During the last few months of my life, my relationship with my dear husband started to feel like it was falling apart.
Bruce used to come home during his lunch breaks to come spend time with me. But he suddenly stopped.
That's very odd, I wonder what the reason was.
Hello Martha!
How are you doing? Do you need some more help rejogging your memory?
Great thank you and yes please!
Edith used to go on and on about a mystery man she was seeing and how exciting it was.
She also used to use smoke break time to go visit this man, almost every day.
But I didn't really care for this type of gossip and didn't want to get involved.
How intriguing.
Alright I'll go see if I can find out some more information.
Hello Edith, are you feeling a bit better now?
Yes, I've had some time to think a bit more, but I'm struggling to remember the details.
Let's do that puzzle of yours again.
I remember that I used to see a new man during my smoke breaks at work, it was so exciting and fresh.
It made me realise what I was missing in my marriage with Jasper. It was everything I ever wanted.
Passionate, affectionate, attentive, spicy. Ugh it was so good.
That sounds... uh... fun?
It was.
Alright, well I'll leave you to it then, looks like you need some time alone.
Hello again, Jasper.
I hope you're feeling a bit better now.
I guess I am.
I've had some time to think but it's all still a bit hazy.
Let's do a puzzle dear.
It's just sad memory after sad memory.
I'm remembering that my relationship with Edith had been strained for a very long time.
The damage inflicted on our marriage was irreparable and there was nothing I could do to save it.
Sorry to hear that love.
Bruce! Hello!
Hello, again.
Need help remembering anything?
I'd like that, thanks.
I'm not sure I want to say what I'm remembering.
I'm here to help you. I can't help if you don't tell me.
Well, I used to see another woman, at the same time as Charlotte.
Was this other woman's name 'Edith' by any chance?
Yes.
I feel awful about it, it's my biggest regret. I can't believe I did that to my poor Charlotte.
It's not a very kind thing for you to have done to someone you were supposed to love.
I'll leave you be.
Charlotte! Hello love.
Do you want to do another puzzle?
That would be great thank you.
It's another Bruce memory.
I remember that I had made Bruce a romantic roast dinner, in an attempt to respark our love.
It seemed to work, as there was a noticable difference in his behaviour.
He became more attentive and came home during his lunch breaks again!
That's great to hear Charlotte.
Well, I won't keep you any longer, I'll go check in with Bruce now.
There you are! I need your help, let's cut the chit chat and get straight to the puzzle.
Alright then.
Finally! It was eating me up inside, not knowing what I did next.
I remember being fed up with the affair with Edith. I ended it and became faithful to Charlotte once again.
Mistakes were made. I realised what I had given up and I regretted hurting Charlotte like that.
I'm glad you've found the errors in your ways.
I'll see how Edith feels about the situation.
Good to see you again Edith.
I know we left on a postive note last time, but I think there's something you'll want to know.
Ready for another puzzle?
I guess so, but you're making me worried.
Why did you make me remember that?!
You've ruined everything! I didn't want to know that!
Bruce called it quits with me and left me all on my own. I couldn't face my husband after what I had done either.
Thanks for nothing.
I'm sorry, I thought you should know.
How are you Jasper?
I've had some time to process everything and now I'm feeling a bit better.
Are you ready to unlock more memories?
Ready as I'll ever be.
Now I'm remembering that I had a day off. The first in a long time, and I went to go run some errands.
So basically my life is just extremely dull and boring.
How disappointing.
You're just remembering one certain event in your life. That doesn't reflect your whole existence!
Thanks, I really needed to hear that.
No problem. Sorry to leave you again when you're upset but I need to find Martha now.
Long time, no see Martha.
It's been a while, thought you forgot about me!
Hey, I'm not the one who's forgotten things!
Speaking of which, let's do a puzzle, I'm dying to know more.
It's just a boring memory.
What is it?
Nothing. I just remember that I saw Jasper in town for the first time in forever.
I saw him buying some pestisides, it must have been for his crops.
What a weird thing to remember. Oh well. Maybe next time will be more interesting.
Sorry about before...
You again. What do you want?
Please give me one more chance, we're so close to figuring everything out.
Fine, let's hurry up and play your stupid puzzle.
Seems I recognised I was in the wrong.
I ended up baking a pie for Charlotte as a subtle apology.
Even though I was jealous and spiteful of her, she didn't deserve the way we treated her behind her back.
I took the pie over to her house and left it on the front porch, with a piece of paper that had 'sorry' written on it.
I couldn't face her and tell her the truth, but I thought it was a good effort on my part.
That's very thoughtful and considerate of you Edith. I'm sure she appreciated the gesture.
How are you Martha?
Great! Let's play the puzzle. I feel like we're close!
I remember that I went over to Charlotte's house one afternoon.
I was planning on telling her that I suspected Bruce was having an affair with Edith.
Though, now that I think about it, I never got around to telling her.
I vaguely remember her being distracted by a pie that was left on her porch.
Later that afternoon she suddenly fell gravely ill and I felt that the timing was wrong.
The thing that's keeping me tied to this graveyard is the fact that I never got to tell Charlotte the truth.
I'm sorry to hear that, love. I'm glad you were trying to do the right thing though.
Hello my dear, Charlotte.
Nice to see you again!
Are you ready to unlock more memories?
I'd love to.
This is the part where I died...
I remember that Martha had come over to spend time with me.
She wanted to tell me something but we were interrupted by a surprise pie delivery.
Later that afternoon I started to become very weak and could no longer stand on my own.
I was bed-ridden for a couple of weeks, until I eventually met my demise.
I'm so sorry to hear that. That must have been absolutley dreadful.
Let me go see what else I can find out.
Hello Bruce.
Hello, there!
Ready to unlock another memory?
Sure am.
I remember that I was on my way to see Charlotte. I wanted to own up to what I had done.
But by the time I got home she was seemingly unconscious on the kitchen floor.
I planned to tell her once she got better but she never did. She passed away before I was able to tell her.
The one thing that's holding me here is the fact that I never got to confess what I had done to her.
I think now is the time to let her know, so that you can both pass on.
You're right, thank you for all of your help.
Jasper, I hope you're feeling better now. How are you?
I'm doing better now, thank you.
Are you ready for another puzzle?
Sure, why not? Can't get any worse.
What is it?
I did something bad.
Edith was always being too much.
I went to visit her, during my break, but she was off somewhere else.
So I decided I'd just go grab a pint at Bruce's bar.
To my surprise, Edith was there... kissing Bruce.
That's when I knew I had to get my revenge.
Edith often baked herself pies and I saw an opportunity.
I bought some pestisides. Something to deal with the pests on my farm and in my home.
While she was distracted, I mixed some in and headed off to work.
I expected to see that wench on the floor when I returned.
But she was perfectly fine.
I asked her if she had eaten the pie and she remarked that it was for Charlotte Thompson.
In that moment my heart stopped. But then I realised this could work in my favour.
Everyone would suspect it was Edith's fault.
Afterall, she hated Charlotte. When word got out about the affair, it made sense.
Killing the competition.
People took pity on me, they finally realised how terribly I had been treated.
I took this secret to my grave but I guess there's nothing left for me anyway.
Wow, um that's a lot to take in dear, I think you need to apologise to a few of the others.
Well I guess the good news is, is that we know what happened.
I need to go and speak with Charlotte.
Hello Charlotte.
Hi! Any news on what happened?
I think we should talk it over with everyone.
*Explains the situation*
Well that's a lot to take in.
Maybe if I had told you my suspicions about Bruce, this never would have happened. I've missed you all these years.
It's not your fault, don't blame yourself for this. You were just doing what you thought was right at the time. I love you Martha.
I never meant to hurt you. I was so selfish. I'm sorry it ended this way.
We were married to each other for 10 years, and you threw all of that away.
You're despicable. I can't even look at you.
My intention was to hurt you and I regret what I have done, so for that I am sorry.
You need to learn how to control your jealousy. Don't take your anger out on others.
You were never meant to get hurt. I'm sorry you got caught in the crossfire of my spat with Edith. You didn't deserve that.
I am not ready to forgive you for what you did to me and what you intended to do to Edith.
Most of you have found what you were searching for, except Jasper. You didn't recieve the forgiveness that you sought after.
I deserve it. I'll stay here and reflect on my actions.
I think the rest of us are ready to move on now. Thank you Meemaw for everything. You've helped us tremedously.
